org.hps.monitoring.ecal.eventdisplay.ui

Class Viewer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • org.hps.monitoring.ecal.eventdisplay.ui.Viewer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible, RootPaneContainer, WindowConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActiveViewer, FileViewer, PassiveViewer

    public abstract class Viewer
extends JFrame
    The abstract class Viewer handles initialization of the calorimeter panel with the proper settings and provides a window for it to live in. Subclasses of Viewer should implement a means for events to be fed to the calorimeter display.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Viewer.EcalMouseListener
      The EcalMouseListener handles removing highlighting and crystal field information when the cursor leaves the window.
      private class  Viewer.EcalMouseMotionListener
      The EcalMouseMotionListener handles updating of the highlighted crystal and status panel information when the mouse moves over the window.
      private class  Viewer.PropertyUpdater
      Updates the settings panel whenever a tracked property in the calorimeter panel is updated.

    • Method Detail

      • addCrystalListener

        public final void addCrystalListener(CrystalListener cl)
        Adds the specified crystal listener to receive crystal events from this component when the calorimeter panel's crystal status is changed. If listener cl is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Parameters:
        cl - - The listener to add.

      • getCrystalListeners

        public final CrystalListener[] getCrystalListeners()
        Gets all of the crystal listeners attached to this object.
        Returns:
        Returns the crystal listeners as an array of CrystalListener objects.

      • isMenuVisible

        public boolean isMenuVisible()
        Indicates whether the menu bar is visible or not.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the menu bar is visible and false otherwise.

      • isMirroredX

        public boolean isMirroredX()
        Indicates whether the calorimeter panel displays the x-axis in mirrored orientation or not. Mirrored orientation displays positive LCSim coordinates on the left-hand side and negative coordinates on the right-hand side. Regular orientation goes from negative coordinates on the left-hand side to positive coordinates on the right-hand side.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the panel is using mirrored coordinates and false if the panel is using regular coordinates.

      • isMirroredY

        public boolean isMirroredY()
        Indicates whether the calorimeter panel displays the y-axis in mirrored orientation or not. Mirrored orientation displays positive LCSim coordinates on the bottom side and negative coordinates on the top side. Regular orientation goes from negative coordinates on the bottom side to positive coordinates on the top side.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the panel is using mirrored coordinates and false if the panel is using regular coordinates.

      • removeCrystalListener

        public final void removeCrystalListener(CrystalListener cl)
        Removes the specified crystal listener so that it no longer receives crystal events from this component. This method performs no function, nor does it throw an exception, if the listener specified by the argument was not previously added to this component. If listener cl is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.
        Parameters:
        cl - - The listener to remove.

      • setMenuVisible

        public final void setMenuVisible(boolean isVisible)
        Sets the menu bar to be either visible or hidden.
        Parameters:
        isVisible - - true indicates that the menu is visible and false that it is not.

      • setMirrorX

        public void setMirrorX(boolean state)
        Sets whether to mirror the x-axis on the calorimeter display.
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that the axis should be mirrored and false that it should not.

      • setMirrorY

        public void setMirrorY(boolean state)
        Sets whether to mirror the y-axis on the calorimeter display.
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that the axis should be mirrored and false that it should not.

      • setStatusField

        public final void setStatusField(String fieldName,
                                 String value)
                          throws NoSuchElementException
        Sets the value of the indicated status field on the calorimeter display.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - - The name of the field to set.
        value - - The value to display in relation to the field.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - Occurs if an invalid field name is provided for argument fieldName.

      • setUseCrystalHighlighting

        public void setUseCrystalHighlighting(boolean state)
        Sets whether the calorimeter panel will highlight any crystals that the mouse cursor passes over.
        Parameters:
        state - - true indicates that crystals will be highlighted and false that they will not.

      • setUseZeroEnergyColorMapping

        public void setUseZeroEnergyColorMapping(boolean state)
        Sets whether zero-energy crystals should be rendered as grey or whether they should use the minimum-energy color from the color scale.
        Parameters:
        state - - false indicates that zero-energy crystals will be rendered in grey and true that they will be rendered as per the color scale.

      • setUseLinearScale

        public void setUseLinearScale()
        Sets the calorimeter panel to be displayed using a linear scale.

      • setUseLogarithmicScale

        public void setUseLogarithmicScale()
        Sets the calorimeter panel to be displayed using a logarithmic scale.

        Converts the calorimeter panel's coordinate pair to the LCSim coordinate system.
        Parameters:
        panelPoint - - A calorimeter panel coordinate pair..
        Returns:
        Returns the coordinate pair in LCSim's coordinate system as an int.

      • usesCrystalHighlighting

        public boolean usesCrystalHighlighting()
        Indicates whether crystal will be highlighted when the cursor passes over them or not.
        Returns:
        Returns true if crystals will be highlighted and false if they will not.

      • usesZeroEnergyColorMapping

        public boolean usesZeroEnergyColorMapping()
        Indicates whether zero-energy crystals are colored using the standard color scale or rendered in grey.
        Returns:
        Returns false if zero-energy crystal will be rendered in grey and true if they will use the regular color scale.

      • usesLinearScale

        public boolean usesLinearScale()
        Indicates whether the panel is scaled linearly.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the scaling is linear and false if the scaling is logarithmic.

      • usesLogarithmicScale

        public boolean usesLogarithmicScale()
        Indicates whether the panel is scaled logarithmically.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the scaling is logarithmic and false if the scaling is linear.
